Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • Room
  • public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Room - a room in an adventure game. A "Room" represents one location in the scenery of the game. It is connected to other rooms via exits. For each existing exit, the room stores a reference to the neighboring room. Each room has a first description, a return description, and a smash string
    Version:
    2016.02.29
    Author:
    Michael KÃ¶lling and David J. Barnes

      Room​(java.lang.String[] firstDescription, java.lang.String returnDescription, java.lang.String smashString)
      Overflow constructor that allows setting of a specific smash string upon room initialization

    • Constructor Detail

      • Room

        public Room​(java.lang.String[] firstDescription,
            java.lang.String returnDescription)
        Create a room described "description". Initially, it has no exits. "description" is something like "a kitchen" or "an open court yard".
        Parameters:
        firstDescription - The description that is displayed when entering a room for the first time.
        returnDescription - The description that is displayed when returning to a room

      • Room

        public Room​(java.lang.String[] firstDescription,
            java.lang.String returnDescription,
            java.lang.String smashString)
        Overflow constructor that allows setting of a specific smash string upon room initialization
        Parameters:
        firstDescription - The description that is displayed when entering a room for the first time.
        returnDescription - The description that is displayed when returning to a room
        smashString - The blurb of text that is displayed when the player uses the smash command in the room

      • Room

        public Room​(java.lang.String[] firstDescription,
            java.lang.String returnDescription,
            boolean canSmash)
        Overflow constructor that allows setting of the canSmash global variable for the room
        Parameters:
        firstDescription - The description that is displayed when entering a room for the first time.
        returnDescription - The description that is displayed when returning to a room
        canSmash - determines whether or not smash can be used in the room. Set to false in other constructors

    • Method Detail

      • setExit

        public void setExit​(java.lang.String direction,
                    Room neighbor)
        Define an exit from this room.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction of the exit.
        neighbor - The room to which the exit leads.

      • getReturnDescription

        public java.lang.String getReturnDescription()
        Picks a description starter at random and returns a description of the room in the form: You are in the kitchen. Exits: north west
        Returns:
        A long description of this room

      • getExit

        public Room getExit​(java.lang.String direction)
        Return the room that is reached if we go from this room in direction "direction". If there is no room in that direction, return null.
        Parameters:
        direction - The exit's direction.
        Returns:
        The room in the given direction.

      • visitRoom

        public void visitRoom()
        Determines whether or not a room has been visited and prints the correct description

      • hasBeenVisited

        public boolean hasBeenVisited()
        Returns a boolean that determines whether or not the room has been visisted
        Returns:
        true if the room has been visited, false otherwise

      • setReturnString

        public void setReturnString​(java.lang.String newDescription)
        Allows setting of the return string
        Parameters:
        newDescription - The string that returnDescription will be set to

      • getSmashString

        public java.lang.String getSmashString()
        Returns smash string
        Returns:
        Either returns a random string if the global variable smashString has not been set, otherwise smashString is returned

      • canSmash

        public boolean canSmash()
        Determines whether the smash command can be used in the room
        Returns:
        value of this.canSmash

      • setSmash

        public void setSmash​(boolean smash)
        Sets whether or not smash can be used in the oom
        Parameters:
        smash - What canSmash should be set to

      • setSmashString

        public void setSmashString​(java.lang.String newSmashString)
        Sets the smash string
        Parameters:
        newSmashString - What smashString should be set to
